name: wetly
content:
wetly adverb
(LIQUID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves water or another liquid: She sat rigidly in her seat, her clothes clinging wetly to her body.
More examplesFewer examplesMy socks squelched wetly with every pedal stroke.Annie's swollen cheeks and eyes glistened wetly - tears, rain? Myrtle did not know which. Fabia, with her long newly washed hair clinging wetly to her, emerged from the bathroom.He had kissed Holly, wetly, on each cheek, and he had not cared who had seen him.

wetly adverb
(PERSON)
UK in a weak way, without any confidence: She said wetly that she thought it would probably be too difficult for her.
More examplesFewer examplesThe plot relies on the relationship between Gregor and his brother Frank (played rather wetly by James Fleet).He didn't apologise, but merely said, wetly: "Well, we didn't find the weapons but we found lots of bodies." She smiled wetly at the children.
